image.altText: A middle-aged man in high-vis looking tired and worried.

props.synopsis: As the WA government looks to expand quarantine boundaries to help stop the spread of the shot-hole borer, a WA arborist who is part of the fight says the pest keeps him awake at night.

title.children: 'Keeps me up at night': Shot-hole borer quarantine zone could expand as concerns grow

image.altText: Maggie Ayres typing on a computer while seated.

props.synopsis: Romance scams are on the rise in WA, with authorities warning people to be vigilant of scammers using artificial intelligence to disguise themselves in video calls.

title.children: Deepfake technology used as West Australians scammed out of millions of dollars

image.altText: A man rests with his hands on the floor of a gym, with dumbbells near him and a woman walking past.

props.synopsis: The family of a Perth bodybuilder who spent 15 hours unconscious in a gym shower without anyone noticing is calling for greater safety measures at gyms.

title.children: Gym safety in the spotlight after bodybuilder's collapse

image.altText: Hayden Young in action for Fremantle

props.synopsis: Fremantle star Hayden Young was thought to be suffering a corked leg as he limped around in the final quarter against Port Adelaide, only for scans to reveal something far more sinister.

title.children: 'Not your normal sort of corky': Hayden Young attempted to play on broken leg to help Dockers reach finals

image.altText: Australian personnel approach one of the boats at Kuri Bay.

props.synopsis: It's been revealed two "repeat offenders" have been given jail terms after being caught fishing illegally in far-north Western Australia earlier this month.

title.children: Two repeat offenders from Indonesia jailed amid a 'massive surge' in illegal fishing

image.altText: A man named Clifford Sunfly stands in front of a Toyota four-wheel drive.

props.synopsis: Ravaged by drug abuse, rampant unemployment and deep social dysfunction, Balgo is one of Australia's most remote communities. But there are opportunities on the horizon, as a community with ancient traditions looks to a modern future.

title.children: In Balgo, getting people into work is the battle. But locals are working hard to drive change

image.altText: Two flame towers from Woodside's Karratha Gas Plant, overlooking the signature red rocks of the Pilbara.

props.synopsis: The Murujuga Aboriginal Corporation says traditional owners are prohibited from objecting to industry projects on the peninsula and the state government is "unwilling" to change that.

title.children: Indigenous elders unhappy with inability to object to industry on culturally significant land

image.altText: A large mining truck painted green after it was converted from diesel to electric.

props.synopsis: New mining technology is being put to the test in Western Australia with trials of "clean, green, cheaper" trucks now underway.

title.children: Mining industry trials large-scale electric, hydrogen trucks amid push to lower emissions

image.altText: A wide shot of houses near the coast.

props.synopsis: People have long moved to the coastal town of Esperance because of its affordability and lifestyle. Since the rental price has surged, some can no longer afford a home.

title.children: Rents soar by 45pc over three months in WA beachside town amid 'alarming' housing shortage

image.altText: Max Chandler Mather CFMEU rally

props.synopsis: Greens leader Adam Bandt has defended his colleague's decision to attend a CFMEU protest where the prime minister was likened to Adolf Hitler, saying the event was "legitimate" despite the "offensive" comparison.

title.children: Greens leader defends MP's CFMEU rally attendance but says Nazi sign 'offensive'

image.altText: Bentinck Island fish traps from the air

props.synopsis: Traditional owners say World Heritage listing would help preserve Australia's largest archaeological site, an elaborate network of stone walls designed to trap fish at low tide in the Gulf of Carpentaria.

title.children: Calls to protect northern Australia's ancient stone wall fish traps from tourists, climate change

image.altText: QPS Constables Rachel McCrow and Matthew Arnold

props.synopsis: It's the fifth and final week of an inquest into the 2022 tragedy, which claimed the life of two police officers and a neighbour.

title.children: Ballistic police vest would not have saved officer killed at Wieambilla, inquest hears

image.altText: Fears Tasmania left exposed after AFP officers removed from Hobart's airport

props.synopsis: AFP officers have walked off the job at seven major airports around the country as part of ongoing industrial action.

title.children: AFP officers walked off the job from seven major airports yesterday, but didn't make their action public due to security concerns

image.altText: Ben O'Connor

props.synopsis: West Australian cyclist Ben O'Connor retains the lead in the Vuelta  a Espana, breaking a 19-year-old record set by Bradley McGee.

title.children: West Aussie O'Connor sets new record in Vuelta a Espana with fifth day in leader's jersey

image.altText: A woman smiling

props.synopsis: Polls put Kamala Harris slightly ahead of Donald Trump in the US election race. But there are two potential stumbling blocks that could up-end the contest once again.

title.children: Kamala Harris is ahead of Donald Trump, but two big wildcards could up-end the race

image.altText: a zoomed in woolworths sign

props.synopsis: Inflation has slowed to 3.5 per cent in the year to July, the latest data from the Bureau of Statistics has revealed, while Woolworths' annual profit plunged 93 per cent due to a massive write-down in the value of its New Zealand supermarkets, and the Australian share market recovered from its earlier drop.

title.children: Inflation slows to 3.5pc, Woolworths profit slumps, ASX recovers from earlier drop — as it happened

image.altText: Man with grey hair and glasses, standing in front of a wall full of old photographs

props.synopsis: Former champion swimming coach Richard "Dick" Caine raped and sexually assaulted young athletes at the pool and in his home and car, a judge finds.

title.children: Dying swim coach found to have raped and sexually assaulted six girls

image.altText: Windmill and blue sky background with movie clapperboard showing 'Runt' on it

props.synopsis: The country town of York is creating a name for itself among Australian television and filmmakers, becoming the backdrop of three major productions over the past 12 months.

title.children: Small WA town inundated by movie industry wants to be 'the Hollywood of the Wheatbelt'

image.altText: Jesse Hogan celebrates a goal with the GWS Giants

props.synopsis: When Jesse Hogan was traded to the GWS Giants at the end of 2020, his career was in tatters. Four years later, he is the AFL's leading goal kicker on a premiership contender. Here is how he scripted one of the most remarkable career turnarounds in the league's recent history.

title.children: 'It does blow my mind': How Jesse Hogan became the AFL's most lethal forward after almost giving up football

image.altText: A firefighter walks past a burnt-out home.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old boy was heading to school on an e-bike in Alexandria when the lithium-ion battery went into thermal runaway and exploded. It comes a day after firefighters put out a major fire at a home in Merrylands that was also caused by a faulty battery.

title.children: Firefighters battle two suspected battery fires across Sydney in the space of two days

image.altText: a close-up of a person holding several pages of a household power bill in their hands

props.synopsis: Australia's peak energy user group and one of its biggest retailers sound the alarm on complex power prices, saying they're not working and may be harming.

title.children: Consumers are 'punished' by cost-reflective power prices, yet they do little of what they're supposed to do

image.altText: A man in a hospital bed with tubes going into his nose and mouth.

props.synopsis: Hepatitis C attacked Dennis Maby's liver over two decades and nearly claimed his life. Now clear of the disease he's urging other people to get tested.

title.children: 70,000 Australians are estimated to be needlessly living with Hep C. They also likely don't know they have it

image.altText: About a dozen student are seen talking in a courtyard, in front of a tall sandstone clock tower at the University of Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The federal government's plan to cap international student numbers has split the tertiary education sector, drawing uproar from prestigious urban universities but cautious optimism from their regional and suburban competitors.

title.children: International student cap draws fury from top universities

image.altText: A composite image of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton.

props.synopsis: The US and UK elections this year are proving to be significant flex points, and that has consequences for us in Australia. But it also shows how clear values are the only workable response to chaos.

title.children: Australia is labouring through wrenching transitions, and there's only one way out of the chaos

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair and wearing glasses looking at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: What was meant to be a dream holiday in Japan for Cassandra Nichterlein and her young family turned into a costly nightmare when their return flight from Japan was cancelled.

title.children: A family was left $7,000 out of pocket after a flight cancellation. Jetstar initially offered them $600

image.altText: Stack of several thousand dollars worth of Australian $50 notes showing David Unaipon

props.synopsis: New analysis released by the super industry has found one in four workers is missing out on compulsory superannuation payments, with women and those in lower-paid jobs worst hit.

title.children: 'Leaves people poorer when they retire': Could you be missing out on super payments?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a beige and brown patterned shirt stands at a lectern, with four Pacific leaders behind him.

props.synopsis: Australia has notched a strategic victory in the Pacific after its peak gathering of leaders endorsed a $400 million major new initiative to reshape policing across the region.

title.children: Strategic victory for Australia as Pacific leaders back policing initiative that could block China

image.altText: A woman holds her child with a demolished home in the background

props.synopsis: As many as 700,000 people are expected to attended an outdoor mass with Pope Francis next month in Dili, so authorities are bulldozing the homes of about 200 of the city's poorest residents to make room.

title.children: 'They've destroyed our homes': Ana Bela's house was bulldozed to make way for a mass with the pope

image.altText: Trump christians pic

props.synopsis: A revised indictment is filed against former US president Donald Trump in the case involving alleged interference of the 2020 US election.

title.children: Donald Trump faces revised US indictment in election subversion case

image.altText: man wearing hat and black shirt

props.synopsis: Visitors hoping to enjoy a little winter sunshine in northern WA instead swelter through unseasonal heat, as tour operators seek workarounds to keep them cool and safe.

title.children: Tourists caught out as temperatures skyrocket 'out of control' across the Kimberley

image.altText: Gemma Houghton holds a footy while leaning on a railing in the stands looking away

props.synopsis: Two-time All Australian Gemma Houghton says her passion for football ran dry after her mate's death, as a study has found female athletes face more psychosocial stressors including exposure to sexual harassment and challenges around parenting.

title.children: Former Dockers star says losing best friend to suicide left her struggling on AFLW field

image.altText: Australian female para-swimmer Rachael Watson takes a breath during a race.

props.synopsis: Classifications are an essential part of the Paralympics, helping group athletes together based on similar levels of impairments to create an even playing field. But it's not always easy to understand — here's our guide to the basics.

title.children: Paralympic classification can be confusing — here's how it works

image.altText: Wheelchair rugby player Beau Vernon poses for a photograph on the court

props.synopsis: As Beau Vernon recovered from a broken neck, nurses told him he would never be able to get dressed without assistance. Now, he is preparing for his Paralympic debut.

title.children: Once a young footy star, Vernon enters Paralympics with determination and purpose

image.altText: Lousie Sauvage

props.synopsis: The journey of the Paralympics from a forgotten event to a global sensation has been a long and frustrating one, but these five athletes help tell the story of how we've arrived at Paris 2024.

title.children: Trailblazing and rebellion — the five women that tell the story of Australia's journey at the Paralympics
